title: How A Recession And By-Election Misery Sent Rishi Sunak Back To Square One
description: Added to the 0.1% contraction in the three months before, it means the country was officially in recession – the very thing the prime minister had promised would not happen. Then, in the early hours of Friday morning, the Tories lost two by-elections to Labour in previously-safe seats.

title: Rishi Sunak urges Right to come together after by-election losses
description: And if they are defeated in both Wellingborough and Kingswood, it would be the third time that two by-elections have been lost on the same day during Rishi Sunak’s premiership. The Tory majority in Kingswood is 11,200, while Wellingborough has a majority of 18,540.

title: Michael Marra defends Labour's energy sector windfall tax plan

title: Worst of Westminster: Tories finished and muted Labour celebrations
description: This UK Government has now seen the most by-election losses of any Conservative administration since the Second World War. In Wellingborough, the figures were stark as Labour’s Gen Kitchen overturned a majority of more than 18,000 with a swing of 28.5% - the second highest of all time.

title: Labour urged to be ‘bold’ after double by-election wins
description: LABOUR was urged to be “bold” after flipping major Tory majorities in the Wellingborough and Kingswood by-elections today. Sir Keir Starmer said the results showed people were “crying out for change” and that his party were “now credible contenders” for this year’s general election.

title: Plan for new East Belfast apartment block causes split at City Hall
description: A new four storey apartment block has been approved for East Belfast despite local objections and a split in Belfast Council. At the recent Belfast City Council Planning Committee meeting, elected representatives went to a vote before passing an application for the erection of a 16 unit apartment building at 215-225 Castlereagh Road, BT5.
